intro: Galium quinquefidum, commonly known as five-angled bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb with slender, often hairy stems that lie close to the ground. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters at the leaf axils. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly wavy margin. Galium quinquefidum is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
